page.title: 01EDALE VILLAGE
page.content: Edale is a small village in a long valley at the foot of Kinderscout in the Peak District National Park.There are about 350 inhabitants living in 5 booths or hamlets _ Grindsbrook Booth, Barber Booth, Ollerbrook Booth, Upper Booth and Nether or Ladybooth.Most of the land is used for sheep-farming.The buildings are of gritstone.There is a church,a chapel,2 public houses,2 residential hostels,3 shops,an information centre and a village hall. The River Noe flows down the valley and there is a road and a railway with a station.The Pennine Way starts at Grindsbrook.There are many visitors all the year,many in cars which cause parking problems.There is hangliding on Mam-Tor ,pony-trekking and ski-ing in winter.There is a Mountain Rescue Service.
